item.description:
Salt marshes, forest, big bridges, river islands, cool swimming, and even cliff diving if you dare!!

& the free Riverfront Music Festival afterwards.

Paddle the historic Merrimac River around islands and through salt marshes. We'll begin in Newburyport amid shiny white fiberglass pleasure boats.  But after crossing the river, we'll enter a quiet, bird-filled salt marsh.  After that, there are forests to explore, rocks to climb, and a couple of great swimming and diving spots to enjoy.

We can make the paddle last as long as we want but figure on 3-4 hours roundtrip.

Bring a change of clothes and afterward we'll walk a few blocks to the RIVERFRONT MUSIC FESTIVAL featuring Adam Ezra and Matt Kearney. The festival runs from noon to 6pm.

Portsmouth Carpool: 10 am @ Portsmouth Bus Station - 185 Grafton Ave. Meet in the the overflow lot - the lot farthest from the main bus terminal building. Meet at the back of the lot.

One rental kayak available - click here.

High Tide: 3:08pm

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

*Unless otherwise specified, refunds for timely cancellations will be processed the day after the event.

*Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.

Click here for a note on event fees.
item.name: Kayak the Merrimac & Riverfront Music Festival!!
